value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">At what point in the Elizabethan drama is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">reader born? At what point do we cease to be</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">aware of the trumpet & the flag; of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">presence <add place="above">[ruchess?]</add> of the audience drawing up the poetry</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">like a sheet of paper drawing up a fire, &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">becoming detached, reading in a room alone.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>The play is</del> <del>The reader came very gradually</del> into</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>existence.</del> The <del>audience was</del> the <del>audience</del> <del>had no</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">book <del>of the words. They</del> Elizabethan audience</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">had no <del>book of the words.</del> <del>They had to see</del> <del>We</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They had to draw in the play <del>through their ears &</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>their eyes; by & thus</del> as they sat <del>there;</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">or stood in the Playhouse; they could not deepen, <del>[illeg/]</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">revive the impression, <del>deepen it, tether it</del> by</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">reading <del>in private</del> the words in <del>private</del> <add place="above">print</add>. <del>Hence</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>And thus</del> a <del>fact which accounts</del> <add place="above">This</add> perhaps for</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the general nature of Elizabethan [illeg.]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>for it</del> its lack of detail, its lack <del>of the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>behind</del> [portal?] [illeg.] <del>What</del> <del>Behind</del> <del>the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The <del>spoken</del> <del>&</del> <del>&</del> & for <del>the general forms</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">it accounts too for the <del>delay</del> <del>slow</del> <del>long</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>delay in</del> <del>marked pause in</del> <del>suspense,</del> <del>in</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>even as <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha" key="Shakespeare, William">Shakespeares</rs> fame</del> long pause, when</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">even Shakespeares <add place="above">fame</add> seems to have hung suspended <del>in</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">unrealised in the air. <del>Then when the plays</del> were</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">printed, that <del>the reader was</del> born: &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">there spring up, from the detailed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great examination, the discovery of much that was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>un</del> lost un the playhouse, & found in the private</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">room.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">its</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Now of course, the reader <del>has</del> reading</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">faculty has become so highly developed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that we have lost a great deal <add place="above">as much as we have</add>: <del>that was</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>then</del> we have lost the sound of the spoken</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">word: we have lost <del>the</del> all that the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">body of the actor gives: we have lost the</l>
